name: Passing Pineview Forest
description: Passing Pineview Forest is a free mini-prequel set in the universe of Pineview Drive. Behind the abandoned house on Pineview Drive lies ominous Pineview Forest...

reviews.review_text: Installs game. Plays game. Walks around a forest, getting freaked out. Calms down, and thinks 'This isn't so scary!' Finds out you have a flashlight. Sees silhouette in the distance. Gets scared as all hell. Turns on flashlight. Sees a scarecrow. Instant relief. Scarecrow turns head. NOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPE Exit game, uninstall, have nightmares for two days. 10/10 would have nightmares about scarecrow again.  EDIT: Wow, people actually looked at this review. I WOULD LIKE TO THANK THE ACADEMY.

Its a fun game. Even though I havent gotten caught by the creature thing yet this game still creeps me out. I love how it tries to build up intensity instead of using endless jumpscares. Tips:  *Every once in a while stop and turn in a full circle slowly to prevent being caught. *When you see the scarecrow try to stay far away from it when you are passing it. *Try to play without using your flashlight. *Don't jerk the camera too much because the creature will sense it and come after you. *Dont run unless you hear running footsteps behind you. You might be able to get away if you start running fast enough. (It might still catch you if you run)
NOPE simulator 2014.   Bonus: Play on Oculus Rift for the Sh*t Your Pants Edition
